file_content.text: Where are the patrol droids and security feeds? This outpost violates Imperial Code 877 as well!
Imperial Code 38.12 dictates that our standard be visible from all directions. We're in violation!
An entire maintenance crew for an intel extraction? This is highly irregular.
My lord. It is an honor to report to someone so close to our glorious Emperor.
Lieutenant. The Imperial uniform has been redesigned again. Truly hideous.
Mercenary. I have been authorized to contract your services for the Empire.
Imperial reconnaissance unit I-M3. Several of my systems remain offline. I was attacked on patrol by the local resistance.
We cannot underestimate these perfidious rebels. Our most recent defeat has given them a significant advantage.
Er, right....
You're standing in a Republic outpost.
Are you broken?
Impossible! Though I have observed several lapses in Imperial protocol.
Glad to hear it.
Do not lose hope. I have analyzed the problem and identified a solution.
I have located the crash site of Shadow Squadron--poor, brave men. The transponders in the downed fighters continue to function.
If properly decoded, the resistance could use the transponders to track other Imperial ships, and blast our noble pilots out of the sky.
So the Imperial fleet plans on a lot of these attacks.
More pilots are coming?
They have been most effective in thinning the Balmorran resistance numbers.
Firing on protesting civilians doesn't sound noble to me.
You're a little biased.
Civilians? These are dangerous reactionaries who threaten Balmorra's stability!
Maybe the Empire should have designed better ships.
All's fair in war.
Impossible. Only the most advanced ships in the galaxy are worthy of the Empire.
A whole squadron. Pretty good for a bunch of farmers.
Balmorra one, Empire zero.
As if they could challenge the strength and might of the Imperial fleet alone.
How would they decode these transponders?
Sounds pretty complicated.
I didn't ask for your report.
I didn't ask for your report.
Several technicians here struggle to repair me. I suspect they are spies.
A Republic officer named Sergeant Durren is helping the resistance. He is responsible for Shadow Squadron's untimely demise.
The transponders must not reach Sergeant Durren. They must be destroyed. I will recommend the fleet target his camp.
[Lie] Not necessary.
Show the Republic our superior strength. Leave no survivors.
Where can I find these missing transponders?
Let me handle that.
The debris is spread across the area. I have uploaded the coordinates to your communicator.
I will await further repairs. Long may we serve the Empire.
You could be leading me into an Imperial trap.
Sounds shady. [Refuse quest]
Sounds shady. [Refuse quest]
Sounds shady. [Refuse quest]
Sounds shady. [Refuse quest]
Error: Circular logic loop. Regarding: Imperial in Imperial trap. Rebooting systems now.
I am awaiting official maintenance and debriefing to continue my service to the Empire.
